greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = (-2*I)^n + (2*I)^n + (1/2 + 1/2*I*sqrt(3))^n + (1/2 - 1/2*I*sqrt(3))^n.
comment: For all n there is an m such that: ||a(n)| - 2^m| <= 2. In the Python program which will be provided, the sequence (a(n)) is given by 4tesseq(X) where X = 1.5'i + .25(ii + jj + kk + ee) is the generating floretion.
link: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (1,-5,4,-4).
mathematica: CoefficientList[Series[4 + x (1 - 10 x + 12 x^2 - 16 x^3)/((x^2 - x + 1) (4 x^2 + 1)), {x, 0, 100}], x] (* _Vincenzo Librandi_, Jun 26 2014 *)
program: (MAGMA) I:=[4,1,-9,-2]; [n le 4 select I[n] else Self(n-1)-5*Self(n-2)+4*Self(n-3) -4*Self(n-4): n in [1..50]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Jun 26 2014
results.author: _Creighton Dement_, Dec 22 2008, Dec 31 2008
